result.execSummary:
The defendant David M. Knack was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: The defendant shall pay Department of Correction fees as directed by the agent.  Defendant was ordered to report immediately to the probation and parole office.

miscConds.notes:
Defendant is ordered to pay the DNA surcharge, and to make arrangements to provide a DNA sample for testing through the Clark County Sheriff Department or if on probation, to the Department of Corrections as is required in all criminal convictions.  Fine and/or costs  paid from bond previously posted
 If defendant's probation is revoked he is to receive credit for 6 days served.
Defendant shall attend counseling, treatments, programming, evaluations as deemed appropriate by the agent releasing all records to the agent upon request

Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol, and not go into places that sell alcohol except incidentally such as a grocery store, convenience store or gas station or other such place where alcohol is not sold for consumption on the premises.  
The defendant shall have no contact with Christine Neustedt  of any kind, whether direct or indirect, including in person, in writing, by phone, by e-mail or other electronic means, through a third party or in any other way.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. David M. Knack

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Prosecutor Kerra Stumbris and Defendant, David M. Knack appeared, pro se Agreement reached.  Defendant finalized  waiver of  right to an attorney after full colloquy.

Pre-trial conference at 10-27-2015 10:30 am.
Status conference at 11-05-2015 11:30 am.

Prosecutor Kerra Stumbris and Defendant, David M. Knack appeared, pro se  Defendant was advised of right to attorney and waived that right  at this time.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 27, 2015 at 10:30 am.  Status conference scheduled for November 5, 2015 at 11:30 am.

The defendant shall have no contact with  T.P., R.G., or C.N.  of any kind, whether direct or indirect, including in person, in writing, by phone, by e-mail or other electronic means, through a third party or in any other way.

ADA Kerra Stumbris appeared for the State  Defendant appeared in person, pro se,  via video conference from Clark County Jail  Defendant advised of right to an attorney  Initial appearance scheduled for October 2, 2015 at 11:30 am.
